definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: So crowded is this bus that I can hardly breathe.
sentences.chinese: 车上如此拥挤以至于我几乎喘不动气。

sentences.english: Never lose your temper in the courtroom.
sentences.chinese: 在法庭上千万不要动气。

sentences.english: If that's the case, I am not surprised he was angry.
sentences.chinese: 假如是那样的，他动气就不敷为奇了。

sentences.english: I hope you will not take any offense at my words.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要因我的话而动气。

sentences.english: Really good friends don't take offence.
sentences.chinese: 非常好的朋友不会动气。

definition: to mind/to brood over/to be concerned about
to push sb too far/to go too far (in oppressing people)
to let emotions affect one's decisions
to lower oneself to sb's level/to argue with sb less well-informed
variant of 慪氣|怄气[ou4 qi4]
where it is possible to let people off, one should spare them (idiom); anyone can make mistakes, forgive them when possible
pinyin: de2 rao2 ren2 chu4 qie3 rao2 ren2

definition: lit. not knowing what's important (idiom); no appreciation of the gravity of things/naive/doesn't know who's who/no sense of priorities
